Connolly Surface Analysis   Figure S13. Connolly surfaces of hierarchical suprestructures self-assembled by (a, b) CSC-1s, (c,d) CDC-1s, and (e, f) CDC-5s, generated by using probe Radii of 1.42 ? and 1.82 ? for H2 (a, c, e) and N2 (b, d, f), respectively. The Connolly surface analyses are based on the crystal structures, and the solvents in the crystals of CDC-1 and CDC-5 were removed before analysis.

S3  (S)-1,3-Dibromobutane: (R)-Butane-1,3-diol (5.00 g, 55.0 mmol) was charged into a Schlenk flask and moisture was removed under low pressure for 10 min. Under a nitrogen atmosphere, liquid PBr3 (15.0 g, 5 mL, 110 mmol) was added slowly by syringe in an ice bath. The viscosity of the reaction mixture decreased during the addition process. Hydrogen bromide was discharged before heating the reaction mixture to 60 oC for 2 h. Upon cooling to 20 oC, iced water was added to quench the reaction, and hexane was used for extraction. The organic phase was collected and washed with NaHCO3 aqueous solution for three times, dried by anhydrous Na2SO4, and concentrated to yield a clear liquid (7.17 g, 60.4% yield). 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) ¦Ä 4.40¨C4.17 (m, 1H), 3.67¨C3.43 (m, 2H), 2.43¨C2.07 (m, 2H), 1.86¨C1.60 (m, 3H). 13C NMR (101 MHz, CDCl3) ¦Ä 48.60, 43.22, 31.34, 26.19. GC-MS: Calcd for C4H8Br2 [M+H]+ 215.897; Found, 215.900.  (R)-Butane-1,3-dithiol: Thiourea (1.92 g, 25.3 mmol) and (S)-1,3-dibromobutane (2.60 g, 12.0 mmol) were refluxed in water (20 mL) under the atmosphere of nitrogen until an homogeneous solution was formed (ca. 2 h). Ethylenediamine (1.66 g, 1.84 ml, 27.7 mmol) was added dropwise into the solution in an ice bath. After the addition was complete, the mixture was heated to 110 oC again for 10 h. The reaction mixture was extracted by ether, dried by anhydrous Na2SO4 and concentrated to yield a yellow liquid (617 mg) which was used directly without further purification.  (4R)-2-(3,5-di(3-Nitrophenyl)phenyl)-4-methyl-1,3-dithiane (DNPMD): Under a nitrogen atmosphere, (R)-butane-1,3-dithiol: (2.68 g, 22.0 mmol) and BF3¡¤OEt2 (3.12 g, 22.0 mmol) were injected into a suspension of 3,5-di(3-nitrophenyl)benzaldehyde   S4 (5.10 g, 14.6 mmol) in 150 mL chloroform. The suspension was heated to 70 oC for 16 h and quenched by 2 M NaOH aqueous solution. The organic phase was collected, and aqueous phase was extracted by dichloromethane. The combined organic phase was dried by anhydrous Na2SO4, concentrated and purified by column chromatography (hexane/dichloromethane = 3:1 to 1:1 v/v) to yield a white solid (4.20 g, 62% yield) as the pure product. 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3) ¦Ä 8.50 (s, 2H), 8.26 (d, J = 11.5 Hz, 2H), 7.99 (d, J = 12.0 Hz, 2H), 7.78 (s, 3H), 7.66 (t, J = 20.0 Hz, 2H), 5.33 (s, 1H), 3.15¨C3.02 (m, 3H), 2.23 (d, J = 15.0 Hz, 1H), 1.71¨C1.63 (m, 1H), 1.31 (d, J = 8.5 Hz, 3H). 13C NMR (126 MHz, CDCl3) ¦Ä 148.87, 141.92, 141.18, 140.46, 133.41, 130.06, 126.90, 126.25, 122.79, 122.23, 52.29, 41.10, 33.93, 32.71, 21.78. MALDI-TOF MS Calcd for C23H20N2O4S2 [M+H]+ 453.090; Found, 453.108.  (4R)-2-(3,5-di(3-Aminophenyl)phenyl)-4-methyl-1,3-dithiane (DAPMD): Stannous chloride dihydrate (8.00 g, 35.3 mmol) and DNPMD (2.00 g, 4.40 mmol) were added into a Schlenk flask which was degassed by nitrogen for three times. After the addition of solvent tetrahydrofuran (90 mL), the solution was heated to 80 oC and refluxed for 24 h. 2 M NaOH aqueous solution was added to quench the reaction during which great amount of white solid appeared. Filtration was carried out and filtrate was collected and concentrated as crude product, which was further purified by column chromatography (hexane/ethyl acetate = 1:1 v/v). The pure product was obtained as wax-like yellow solid (1.42 g, 82% yield). 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) ¦Ä 7.69 (s, 1H), 7.62 (s, 2H), 7.22 (t, J = 15.2 Hz, 2H), 7.03 (d, J = 7.6 Hz, 2H), 6.95 (s, 2H), 6.69 (d, J = 7.8 Hz, 2H), 5.27 (s, 1H), 3.74 (s, 4H), 3.12¨C3.00 (m, 3H), 2.20 (d, J = 14.4 Hz, 1H), 1.70¨C1.60 (m, 1H), 1.27 (d, J = 6.8 Hz, 3H). 13C NMR (101 MHz, CDCl3) ¦Ä 146.96, 142.52, 142.10, 139.68, 129.92, 126.40, 125.69, 117.99, 114.56, 114.22, 52.96, 41.17, 34.22, 32.89, 21.96. MALDI-TOF MS Calcd for C23H24N2S2 [M+H]+ 393.141; Found, 393.144.

S5  CDC-5: TFA (0.66 M in chloroform, 150 ¦ÌL, 0.1 mmol) was added into 60 mL chloroform solution of DAPMD (200 mg£¬0.51 mmol), followed by addition of 1,3,5-triformylbenzene (100 mg, 0.34 mmol) which dissolved in 40 mL chloroform. The reaction was stirred at 25 oC for 24 h, and NaBH(OAc)3 (1.12 g, 5.28 mmol) was added to selectively reduce the exterior imines of the catenated cage. After stirred for 8 h, NaHCO3 aqueous was added for neutralization. The organic phase was collected, dried by Na2SO4 and concentrated to get 150 mg yellow crude product. Hexane, methanol and ethyl acetate were applied to wash the crude product to obtain pure product (44% yield). 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3) ¦Ä 8.40 (s, 6H), 8.02 (s, 6H), 7.76 (s, 6H), 7.64 (s, 12H), 7.37 (s, 6H), 7.29 (t, J = 19.0 Hz, 9H), 7.18 (d, J = 8 Hz, 6H), 7.11 (m, 12H), 6.97 (s, 6H), 6.93¨C6.85 (m, 12H), 6.66 (d, J = 8.5 Hz, 6H), 5.16 (s, 6H), 4.15 (s, 12H), 3.90 (s, 6H), 3.08¨C2.88 (m, 18H), 2.15 (d, J = 14.5 Hz, 6H), 1.62 (d, J = 8.5 Hz, 6H), 1.22 (d, J = 8.5 Hz, 18H). 13C NMR (126 MHz, CDCl3) ¦Ä 159.79, 152.03, 148.93, 141.91, 141.22, 140.06, 140.98, 139.50, 138.84, 137.12, 129.97, 129.76, 129.07, 128.68, 125.92, 125.15, 124.57, 121.65, 117.89, 116.71, 113.45, 111.85, 52.88, 49.32, 40.98, 34.10, 32.73, 21.80. General Information Chemicals and solvents were purchased from commercial resources and used as received unless otherwise indicated. The purification of tetrahydrofuran was carried out under nitrogen by sodium. Synthesis and characterization of CSC-1 and CDC-1 were reported previsously.S1 Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR) spectra were recorded on a Bruker Advance III HD 400 or Bruker Advance III HD 500 spectrometer. MALDI-TOF MS spectrum was recorded on a solariX XR 7.0 T hybrid quadrupole-FTICR mass spectrometer equipped with an ESI/APCI/MALDI ion source (Bruker Daltonics, Bremen, Germany), using DCTB (10 mg/mL in CHCl3) as the matrix. Single Crystal X-ray data was collected on a Bruker D8 Venture diffractometer under 170 K. Structure was solved by structure solution program SHELXTS2 using Intrinsic Phasing and SHELXLS3 was applied for the refinement according to Least Squares minimization. The interface was provided by Olex2S4.  2. Synthesis of Precursors and CDC-5  3,5-Di(3-nitrophenyl)benzaldehyde: Into a flame-dried Schlenk flask were added solid reagents 3,5-dibromobenzaldehyde (4.00 g, 15.2 mmol), 3-nitrobenzeneboronic acid (7.59 g, 45.5 mmol), K2CO3 (31.4 g, 227 mmol) and Pd(PPh3)4 (0.88 g, 0.76 mmol), after which the flask was degassed by nitrogen for three times. After the injection of toluene (150 mL), ethanol (150 mL) and water (80 mL), the reaction mixture was heated to 90 oC and reflux for 24 h. Residue was cooled to 20 oC and filtrated to get a yellow filtrate cake, which was washed by toluene and then methanol. It yielded a grey solid (4.20 g, 80% yield) as pure product. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) ¦Ä 10.22 (s, 1H), 8.56 (s, 2H), 8.32 (d, J = 9.2 Hz, 2H), 8.20 (s, 2H), 8.11 (s, 1H), 8.03 (d, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 7.73 (t, J = 16.0 Hz, 2H). HR-MS (ESI): Calcd for C19H12N2NaO5 [M+H]+ 371.064; Found, 371.065.Note: 13C NMR spectrum is unavailable because of its bad solubility in all deuterated solvents.

We previously developed a synthetic strategy to constructcatenane with two dissymmetric cages (CDC).14We startedfrom the catenane composed of two symmetric cages, namely,CSC-1 . As the inner cavity of CSC-1 is inaccessible byvoluminous NaBH(OAc)3, it allowed us to selectively reduceall imines on its exterior panels, leading to the formation ofCDC-1 .S i m i l a r l y , CDC-5 was produced by a two-stepprocedure. A [4 + 6] cycloimination reaction of four TFBpanels and six (4 R)-2-(3,5-di(3-aminophenyl)phenyl)-4-meth-yl-1,3-dithiane ( DAPMD ) linkers ?rst yielded CSC-5 . Thesubsequent selective reduction of the exterior imines of CSC-5by bulky reductant NaBH(OAc)3led to the formation ofCDC-5 (44% two-step overall yield, see the SupportingInformation for details). Its chemical structure was con ?rmedby MALDI-TOF and NMR spectroscopies, respectively(Figures S8 ?S12). The MALDI-TOF spectrum of CDC-5shows an ion peak at m/z2799.936 ([M + H]+calcd for2799.927), and its1H NMR spectrum exhibits the resonancesrelated to the exterior amine bonds (protons H b¡äand H n¡ä), theinterior imine bonds (proton Hs¡ä),TFB (protons Ha¡äand Hr¡ä),and two sets of DAPMD (typically protons H c¡ä?Hf¡ävs protonsHj¡ä?Hm¡ä), respectively.
